Hero.subtitle: Hello! We are ACM Javeriana, a group of students passionate about technology and innovation.

Activities.title: Our Activities
Activities.description: In our community, we organize activities such as practical workshops, programming competitions, and collaborative projects. Our goal is to learn together, improve our skills, and enjoy solving technological challenges as a team.

cpMembers.title: Meet our competitive programming group!
cpMembers.description: We are a passionate group committed to competing and standing out every day

preExams.title: Reinforce your knowledge before exams with our workshops

courses.title: Learn new skills with our courses and workshops

Members.title: Our Team
Members.description: Meet the talented individuals who make our chapter exceptional

hero.text: Where algorithms come alive and the passion for code unites us

rules.title: Rules of the Javeriana Programming League

objectives.title: Contest Objectives
objectives.item1: Promote problem-solving and logical thinking through programming.

participation.title: Participation Criteria
participation.item1: The contest is open to students from all faculties of Universidad Javeriana.
participation.item2: Participants must register in advance on the event platform.

format.title: Contest Format
format.item1: Contests are divided into qualifiers and finals.
format.item2: Participants will have limited time to solve a series of programming problems.

evaluation.title: Evaluation
evaluation.item1: Evaluation will be based on the results provided by the evaluation system of

specific.title: Specific Rules
specific.item1: No Artificial Intelligence (AI) may be used.
specific.item2: Only official C++ documentation may be used:
specific.item3: If after 15 minutes no one has submitted the exercise, a speed test will be used as a tiebreaker.
specific.item4: The contest dynamics are 1vs1: whoever submits the solved exercise first wins.
specific.item5: Rankings are determined by number of victories. In case of a tie in victories, the winner will be the one who has played fewer matches.

conduct.title: Conduct During the Contest
conduct.item1: The use of unauthorized external resources, such as discussion forums or previously solved code, is prohibited.
conduct.item2: All participants are expected to maintain an attitude of respect and honesty.
conduct.item3: Failure to comply with the rules may result in disqualification.

upcomingEvents.title: Upcoming Events
upcomingEvents.subtitle: Don't miss any contest!
upcomingEvents.noEvents: No events match your search parameters
upcomingEvents.followSocial: Stay tuned to our social networks! That's how you'll know when we have an event of your interest.
